com.hcl.domino.data

Interface Attachment


  • public interface Attachment
    Attachment in a Document
    Since:
    0.5.0
    Author:
    t.b.d.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Attachment.Compression
      Enum for method of compression.
      static interface  Attachment.IDataCallback
      Callback class to read the streamed attachment data

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void deleteFromDocument()
      Deletes an attached file item from a note and also deallocates the disk space used to store the attached file in the database.
      void extract(Path targetFilePath)
      Writes the attachment data to a designated path.
      Attachment.Compression getCompression()
      Gets the compression type for the attachment
      DominoDateTime getFileCreated()
      Gets the created datetime of the attachment.
      DominoDateTime getFileModified()
      Gets the modified datetime of the attachment
      String getFileName()
      Gets the filename for the attachment
      long getFileSize()
      Gets the filesize of the attachment
      InputStream getInputStream()
      Retrieves an input stream to access the data of the attachment.
      Document getParent()
      Returns the parent document of this attachment
      void readData(Attachment.IDataCallback callback)
      Method to access the binary attachment data
      void readData(Attachment.IDataCallback callback, int offset)
      Method to access the binary attachment data beginning at an offset in the file.

    • Method Detail

      • getFileName

        String getFileName()
        Gets the filename for the attachment
        Returns:
        filename, not null

      • getCompression

        Attachment.Compression getCompression()
        Gets the compression type for the attachment
        Returns:
        compression enum

      • getFileSize

        long getFileSize()
        Gets the filesize of the attachment
        Returns:
        filesize in bytes

      • getFileCreated

        DominoDateTime getFileCreated()
        Gets the created datetime of the attachment. TODO: Is the datetime it was attached, or the original created datetime of the file?
        Returns:
        datetime the file was initially created

      • getFileModified

        DominoDateTime getFileModified()
        Gets the modified datetime of the attachment
        Returns:
        the modified datetime of the attachment

      • readData

        void readData(Attachment.IDataCallback callback,
              int offset)
        Method to access the binary attachment data beginning at an offset in the file. The method is only supported when the attachment has no compression. Otherwise we will throw an UnsupportedOperationException.
        Parameters:
        callback - callback is called with streamed data
        offset - offset to start reading

      • readData

        void readData(Attachment.IDataCallback callback)
        Method to access the binary attachment data
        Parameters:
        callback - callback is called with streamed data

      • deleteFromDocument

        void deleteFromDocument()
        Deletes an attached file item from a note and also deallocates the disk space used to store the attached file in the database.

      • getParent

        Document getParent()
        Returns the parent document of this attachment
        Returns:
        document

      • extract

        void extract(Path targetFilePath)
      throws IOException
        Writes the attachment data to a designated path.

        Implementation note: using a local filesystem path is more efficient than using a path from an abstracted provider.

        Parameters:
        targetFilePath - the file path of the file to write
        Throws:
        IOException - in case of I/O errors

      • getInputStream

        InputStream getInputStream()
                    throws IOException
        Retrieves an input stream to access the data of the attachment.
        Returns:
        a new InputStream for the attachment data
        Throws:
        IOException - in case of I/O errors
